2130/A0/08/004/003.indicator_name: Number of targeted governorates with a pre-trial diversion program within the juvenile justice system.
2130/A0/08/004/003.headline: Overall  especially at governorate level  juvenile justice authorities in Iraq have improved coordination and provision of child friendly justice procedures and services.  In addition  in four governorates  courts have increasingly applied alternatives to detention for children in conflict with the law so that children spend less time in detention.

2130/A0/08/004/003.indicator_name: Number of targeted Governorates where the Juvenile Delinquency prevention plan exists and are implemented.
2130/A0/08/004/003.headline: Overall  especially at governorate level  juvenile justice authorities in Iraq have improved coordination and provision of child friendly justice procedures and services.  In addition  in four governorates  courts have increasingly applied alternatives to detention for children in conflict with the law so that children spend less time in detention.

2130/A0/08/004/002.indicator_name: Number of Governorates with functional child protection systems.
2130/A0/08/004/002.headline: In the first half of 2017  five governorates improved quality of child protection service delivery and increased functionality of systems. Quality was improved by establishment of referral pathways  increasing availability of services  and supporting dedicated human resources for child protection and gender based violence case management.

2130/A0/08/004/002.indicator_name: Number of Governorates in which Government  NGO  and CSO service providers use developed coordinated referral pathways to respond to reported child protection cases.
2130/A0/08/004/002.headline: In the first half of 2017  five governorates improved quality of child protection service delivery and increased functionality of systems. Quality was improved by establishment of referral pathways  increasing availability of services  and supporting dedicated human resources for child protection and gender based violence case management.

2130/A0/08/004/001.indicator_name: Number of newly enacted or amended child protection laws and policies which meet international standards.
2130/A0/08/004/001.headline: Iraq has strengthened its framework for a protective environment through endorsement of National Child Protection (CP) Policy and work to finalize the Kurdistan Regional CP Policy. Federal child law and regional CP law are under review to align with international standards.  In Kurdistan  work continues to establish alternative care.

2130/A0/08/004/001.indicator_name: Existence of a system for monitoring and reporting of child rights violations  including children in detention.
2130/A0/08/004/001.headline: Iraq has strengthened its framework for a protective environment through endorsement of National Child Protection (CP) Policy and work to finalize the Kurdistan Regional CP Policy. Federal child law and regional CP law are under review to align with international standards.  In Kurdistan  work continues to establish alternative care.

2130/A0/08/004/005.indicator_name: Number and percentage of UNICEF-targeted separated and unaccompanied children receiving alternative care services
2130/A0/08/004/005.headline: Children in humanitarian need had increased access to services in first half of 2017. 261 947 IDP and refugee children received psychosocial support to improve their well-being. Quality of specialized services has improved and reached 18 940 IDP and refugee children. 18 503 women and girls received multi-sectoral GBV services.

2130/A0/08/004/005.indicator_name: Number and percentage of UNICEF-targeted children receiving psychosocial support
2130/A0/08/004/005.headline: Children in humanitarian need had increased access to services in first half of 2017. 261 947 IDP and refugee children received psychosocial support to improve their well-being. Quality of specialized services has improved and reached 18 940 IDP and refugee children. 18 503 women and girls received multi-sectoral GBV services.

2130/A0/08/004/005.indicator_name: Percentage and number of UNICEF-targeted children and women in humanitarian situations who experience GBV receiving multisectoral support services (health  psychosocial  livelihood/economic strengthening and justice)

Quality of specialized services has improved and reached 18 940 IDP and refugee children. 18 503 women and girls received multi-sectoral GBV services.

2130/A0/08/004/004.indicator_name: Percentage of reported incidents of grave violations that are verified.
2130/A0/08/004/004.headline: The Iraq Monitoring and Reporting Mechanism for grave violations of child rights increased its reach and verification rate  so that timely and accurate reporting informs programming and advocacy. Children and families have increased knowledge of risks from unexploded ordinance and IED's through education and awareness.

2130/A0/08/006/002.indicator_name: Reflection of key children's issues in the National Development Plan 2018-2022
2130/A0/08/006/002.headline: UNICEF and the Central Statistics Office finalized the survey plan for MICS-6  to support child-focused knowledge and evidence to inform and guide policy decisions on the situation of women and children in Iraq. The Child Poverty Report was launched and findings helped shape Iraq&#39 s Poverty Reduction Strategy-II.

2130/A0/08/001/002.indicator_name: Percentage of health workers with updated knowledge and skills to prevent and manage malnutrition.
2130/A0/08/001/002.headline: Three new Nutrition Rehabilitation Centres were established  and 93 staff trained on malnourishment management. Three hospitals were certified as `Baby-Friendly'. UNICEF developed a training package for PHC delivery of nutrition services. 24 625 displaced mothers accessed feeding counselling  and 12 937 Syrian mothers accessed services in refugee camps.

2130/A0/08/001/002.indicator_name: Percentage of targeted children (6 - 59 months) in select districts receiving vitamin A supplementation nationally and in select districts.

2130/A0/08/001/003.indicator_name: Percentage of UNICEF-targeted children 9 months to 15 years in affected areas) in humanitarian situations vaccinated against measles.
2130/A0/08/001/003.headline: UNICEF supported two rounds of Polio National Immunization Days (PNID) that reached over 5.6 million children under 5 years and replenished damaged cold chain equipment in newly-accessible Primary Healthcare Centres (PHC) in conflict-affected governorate of Anbar  Ninewa  and Salah al Din.

2130/A0/08/001/001.indicator_name: National Neonatal Action Plan developed and budgeted
2130/A0/08/001/001.headline: The budgeted Iraq Every New-born Action Plan was launched as a framework for progress on neonatal mortality reduction. Standard specifications on infant formula labels were changed to match international guidelines. The pneumococcal vaccine was introduced as part of national `switch' strategy.

2130/A0/08/001/001.indicator_name: National Nutrition Strategy revised and budgeted
2130/A0/08/001/001.headline: The budgeted Iraq Every New-born Action Plan was launched as a framework for progress on neonatal mortality reduction. Standard specifications on infant formula labels were changed to match international guidelines. The pneumococcal vaccine was introduced as part of national `switch' strategy.

2130/A0/08/003/002.indicator_name: Number of children accessing quality learning in schools with SBM approach
2130/A0/08/003/002.headline: The Minister of Education issued a Directive giving increased devolved authorities to schools  a key component of SBM. 98 new schools adopted the approach  benefitting 91 371 students. The MoE and UNICEF agreed an exit strategy for SBM schools and secured a Directive for SBM schools to operate individual bank accounts.

2130/A0/08/003/003.indicator_name: Number of OOS children (5-18) back to school in 10 targeted governorates
2130/A0/08/003/003.headline: More than 556 000 vulnerable children were accessing education opportunities. A total of 376 schools have been constructed or rehabilitated  through UNICEF technical and financial support  including 214 schools rehabilitated in Mosul. A completed Non-Formal Education (NFE) Conceptual Framework was finalized with UNICEF technical support.
